events.1530: Babur's eldest son Humayun ascended the throne. He was, doubtless, a man of parts.
events.1844: W.C. Bonerjee, first President of the Indian National Congress, was born in Kidderpore, Calcutta.
events.1885: A group of middle-class intellectuals in India, some of them British, found the Indian National Congress to be a voice of Indian opinion to the British government. This was the origin of the later Congress Party which was founded in Bombay.
events.1904: K. V. Puttappa, famous Kannada poet and Gyanpeeth awardee, was born at Hirekodage.
events.1909: Congress at Lahore adopts resolution praising Indians' struggle in South Africa and urged ban on indenture.
events.1927: Hakim Ajmal Khan, freedom fighter, litterateur and a true patriot, died.
events.1938: Mahavir Prasad Dvivedi, famous litterateur, writer, poet and editor, died at the age of 74.
events.1949: Syed Mujtaba Hussain Kirmani, cricketer (Indian keeper after Engineer), was born in Madras.
events.1965: First Indian-made tank 'Vijayanta' rolled off the Avadi Heavy Vehicles factory.
events.1968: Chunilal Kalidas Madiya, famous Gujrathi playwright, story writer and novelist, died.
events.1972: Construction work of Metro Train in Calcutta commenced.
events.1977: World's biggest Drive-In theatre started screening in Bombay.
events.1983: Gavaskar makes the highest Test Cricket score by an Indian, 236* vs West Indies.
events.1984: Rajiv Gandhi claims for Indian Prime Minister post after his landslide majority in 8th General Elections.
events.1989: Prasar Bharati Bill and Lok Pal Bill introduced in Lok Sabha.
events.1997: Sonia Gandhi stepped into active politics.
